thread.title: Thrive Market and Jillian Michaels Partner With Blue Star Families For Workout and Health Event on the USS Midway
thread.title_full: Thrive Market and Jillian Michaels Partner With Blue Star Families For Workout and Health Event on the USS Midway - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Thrive Market and Jillian Michaels Partner With Blue Star Families For Workout and Health Event on the USS Midway
text:
Thrive Market
Thrive Market's giving program enables them to distribute thousands of free memberships to veterans
SAN DIEGO , Oct. 20, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- On Saturday, workout guru Jillian Michaels joined Thrive Market and hundreds of active military service members and their families on the USS Midway aircraft carrier for a workout and a conversation about the importance of healthy eating. The event was held in partnership with Blue Star Families (BSF) , a nonprofit organization serving military service members and their families across the globe and Thrive Market , an e-commerce shopping club that makes healthy products affordable to everyone at wholesale prices. Through Thrive Market's membership matching program, every paid membership on the site sponsors a free membership for military family member or veteran, a low-income family, teacher, or student. Thrive Market is giving away 50,000 memberships to military families and veterans in the next year as part of a larger campaign focused on the military community's health.
Many active military, military families and veterans face health issues ranging from physical injuries to mental health challenges. Eating a healthy diet is an important part of maintaining mental and physical health for those who are working hard to serve our country. Jillian spoke to the group about healthy living, led the group in a workout, and talked about her passion for expanding access to healthy food for all.
"We are honored to be working with Blue Star Families, an amazing organization that is doing such important work to help those who are serving our country," said Nick Green , Thrive Market Co-Founder and Co-CEO. "Through this partnership, Thrive Market hopes to give back to the people who have served our country, providing them with access to healthy food at affordable prices."
Blue Star Families is one of the largest chapter based military family nonprofits in the country, serving 1.5 million people each year through their innovative programs and resources, with 47 chapters at home and overseas. By partnering with Thrive Market, BSF will distribute free memberships to their members.
"The health and wellness of our All-Volunteer Force and their families is Blue Star Families' top priority, especially after more than 14 years of combat. Supporters like Thrive Market and Jillian Michaels , who have reached across to bridge the gap between the military and civilian communities, are stellar examples of 'Blue Star Neighbors,'" says Noeleen Tillman , Executive Director of Blue Star Families. "We are proud to share this new partnership with our 100,000 members across the globe."
The partnership with Blue Star Families helps Thrive Market achieve its mission of expanding access to healthy living to all.
About Thrive Market
Thrive Market is a membership-based online shopping club on a mission to make healthy living easy and affordable. Thrive Market members can buy the best-selling organic foods and products in everyday sizes at up to 50% below retail price with free and fast nationwide home delivery. For every paid membership, Thrive Market donates a free membership to a family in need, so we can all thrive together. ( www.thrivemarket.com )
About Blue Star Families
Blue Star Families is a national, nonprofit network of military families from all ranks and services, including guard and reserve, dedicated to supporting, connecting and empowering military families. With our partners, Blue Star Families hosts a robust array of morale and empowerment programs, including Books on Bases, Blue Star Museums, Operation Honor Corps, Blue Star Careers and Operation Appreciation . Blue Star Families also works directly with the Department of Defense and senior members of local, State and Federal government to bring the most important military family issues to light. Working in concert with fellow nonprofits, community advocates and public officials, Blue Star Families raises awareness of the challenges and strengths of military family life and works to make military life more sustainable. Our worldwide membership includes military spouses, children, parents and friends, as well as service members, veterans and civilians. For more information visit bluestarfamilies.org, Facebook/bluestarfamilies or Twitter.com/BlueStarFamily.
Contact: Rachel Krupa , Krupa Consulting
